TextLang.Text: A connection error has occurred. The WLAN switch on the PSP™ system is not turned on.
A connection error has occurred. The WIRELESS switch on the PSP™ system is not turned on.
A connection error has occurred. You have been disconnected from the access point.
A connection error has occurred. The signal may be weak.
A connection error has occurred. Please try again.
This feature allows for remote operation of a PlayStation®3 system on this system. To use this feature you must first select [Network] > [Remote Play] on the PS3™ system.
Quit and Turn Off the PS3™ System
Quit Without Turning Off the PS3™ System
A connection error has occurred. The connection to the PS3™ system has timed out.
A connection error has occurred. The connection to the PS3™ system has been terminated.
A connection to the PS3™ system could not be established. Another device is connected to the PS3™ system.
A system software update for the PSP™ system is required. Go to [Settings] > [System Update] to update the system.
A system software update for the PS3™ system is required. For update methods, refer to the instructions for the PS3™ system.
You must register this system with the PS3™ system. For instructions, refer to the online manual for the PS3™ system.
The PS3™ system that this system is registered with was not found. Check that you have selected [Network] > [Remote Play] on the PS3™ system.
Performs the same operations as the PS button of the PS3™ system.
This feature allows for remote operation of a PlayStation®3 system on this system. Select the method for connecting to the PS3™ system.

You must sign in to PlayStation®Network both on this system and on the PS3™ system using the same sign-in ID (e-mail address). Also, after signing in on the PS3™ system, you must select [Network] > [Remote Play]. If [Settings] > [Remote Play Settings] > [Remote Start] has been set to [On], the PSP™ system can establish a connection even when the PS3™ system is turned off.

Select [Network] > [Remote Play] on the PS3™ system. If [Settings] > [Remote Play Settings] > [Remote Start] has been set to [On], the PSP™ system can establish a connection even when the PS3™ system is turned off.

The PS3™ system was not found. Check that you are signed in on the PS3™ system using the same sign-in ID (e-mail address) as for this system, and have selected [Network] > [Remote Play] on the PS3™ system.
A connection with the PS3™ system could not be established. Check that you are signed in using the same sign-in ID (e-mail address) on this system and on the PS3™ system.
You can use the PSP™ system buttons as the controller buttons for the PS3™ system.
In addition to using the PSP™ system buttons as the controller buttons for the PS3™ system, you can also perform the operations listed above.
Select from Types 1 through 5 (preset combinations), or Custom. If you select Custom, you can set the option levels individually.
If you increase the response speed, audio / video skipping may occur in some network environments.
If you increase the image quality, audio / video skipping may occur in some network environments.
Please wait... It will take at most %1 seconds to connect.
